title.rendered: Why You Should Never Live Alone in the City

content.rendered:
If you’re thinking about living in NYC, then you should also think about getting a roommate. The truth is, that you should never live alone in the city. It can be dangerous for several reasons from increased risk of depression. Although some people may dream of living alone, you may change your mind after reading this.

Here are 7 reasons why you should never live alone in the city.

1. Living alone comes with increased risk of depression

Whether it’s a feeling of being disconnected from others or something else, this study shows that people who live alone tend to take 80% more antidepressants than those who never live alone. If you’re already prone to depression, then it’s especially important that you find yourself a roommate. So you can avoid things getting worse by living alone in NYC.

2. Living alone makes it difficult to make new friends

You’d think living alone in a big city would keep you from needing a roommate in order to make friends. Despite the number of people living in NYC, it’s hard to make friends since so many stick to their circles. Which is why you should never live alone in NYC. And by having a roommate, you not only have at least one friend to count on, but you also have easy access to their social circles.

3. You should never live alone in NYC to avoid going broke

It’s not a surprise that living alone in NYC is expensive. And even apartments in dangerous areas are usually out of most people’s price range. Which is why you should never alone in NYC. And you should consider the added cost of utility bills, food, and everything else. Additionally, you can cut the rent and utilities in half by living with a roommate.

4. Living alone causes greater anxiety

When it comes to the Big Apple, there’s a lot of reasons to be anxious. Especially if you’re new to the city and don’t know your way around. Although it’s generally safe to live alone in NYC as long as you’re smart about it, most people would agree that it’s much safer to live with a roommate. And having someone with you is a good way to ease anxiety.

5. You should never live alone so you have help in emergencies

Emergencies happen, whether you’re in need of medical attention or simply need to get across town as fast as possible. If you’re living alone in NYC without a roommate, chances are you won’t have anyone to rely on when facing an emergency, which will only make the situation worse. If you never live alone and have a roommate, you can breathe easy knowing that should you need help, you’ll have it.

6. Living alone makes it harder to get around the city

If you find yourself a roommate that’s been living in NYC for a while, that makes it incredibly easy to find your way around the city. Even if your roommate is also new to the city, you can still get around much more safely and easily if you never live alone. It also means saving money on cabs since you can split the cost, and makes all of your adventures that much more fun since you’ll have someone with you.

D’you know what else Roomi does outside of helping its readers decide whether or not they should live alone in NYC? With our ever-increasing lists of rooms and roommates across the world, we help you find your perfect match! Download the app here and hop on the easiest ride home, ever!
